question: Who was "Aime Cesaire"?
explanation: Aime Cesaire was a Francophone and French poet from the Martinique Island, an overseas territory of France. He was one of the founders of the negritude movement in the Francophone literature. His works included "Une Tempete", a response to Shakespeare's play "The Tempest" and "Discours sur le colonialisme" (Discourse on Colonialism).
